title: LR circuit two switches and time constant

content.question: In the circuit shown, the two identical resistors have resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> and the inductor has inductance <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>. When only Switch <math alttext="S sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>S</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is closed, the current in the battery reaches <math alttext="63%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>63</mn><mi>%</mi></math> of its asymptotic value after a time interval <math alttext="delta t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. When switches <math alttext="S sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>S</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="S sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>S</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> are closed simultaneously, the current in the battery reaches <math alttext="63%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>63</mn><mi>%</mi></math> of its asymptotic value after a time interval <math alttext="delta t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="delta t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta t sub 1 is less than delta t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta t sub 1 equals delta t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta t sub 1 is greater than delta t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta t sub 1 is greater than open parenthesis, delta t sub 2 equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta t sub 1 is less than delta t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 13.5: Circuits with Resistors and Inductors (LR Circuits)

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
